text: doggo bestest of boys.
author: earthboundkid1

text: I remember the first time fighting this fella. All was going good until I saw Sif dragging his poor paws because his health was so low to the extent his moves was slagging. I swear, I felt freaking sad at this point and as I killed him I was like...."Was this...worth it? Was killing a wolf who guarded his best friend worth killing?" These are the few moments Dark Souls has to make you feel this way and my gosh it almost gave me a roller coaster of feelings.
author: xXTheHeroicGamerXx

text: Yea that series in general never really makes you feel like a good guy hell even killing gwyn is like destroying an entire civilizations work or like in 2 all that nashandra was doing was following her instincts of survival and we kill her because of some crazy green lady who tells us alot of stuff we have to do for no good reason

text:
I know that people are really wasteful with statements like this but: for me Dark Souls is the new Crowned King of all the Videogames after ca. ~2005.
It has something nostalgic on it although this game is rather new. For me it is utter perfection in it's genre.

text: Sakuraba wrote the score for Dark Souls? Never would've guessed. Gotta give him props though, the music fits the game's mood perfectly and really adds to the tension of fighting the (mostly) really tough bosses.
author: Reggie Nintendo

text: @SupraDarky Oh you really should play this game, its a beautiful masterpiece of concept, atmosphere and feeling.
author: Niemandswasser

text: @bogulmon I know. I would say the game patronized me more than I ever could back though. It is a very well made game in some areas, and I did try to enjoy it, but it felt a lot worse than demons souls somehow, especially if you didn't go online for help. There' s a new patch that has helped though, apparently. And I agree the mechanics in Skyrim aren't always as satisfying.
author: Alp A

text:
@robbyalp Reducing Dark Souls to just difficulty is not setting the record straight, not in the least. Dark Souls feels more fulfilling mechanically than any game I can remember in the past few years. Skyrim gives a great feeling of freedom and is a great game in it's own right.

Also, saying "a bunch of Japanese people trying their best" is very patronizing.

text: @utbunny Because some people get off on "being in the minority". Anything to feel unique.

author: Iwannaplayssbb

text: @LocoJoe I have and enjoyed what I played of Dark Souls, I got roughly to Lost Izalith I think? However, I'm just curious as to what you think Dark Souls has over Skyrim as I can't seem to see it. It seems like a more old fashioned and sort of...linear game, outdated if you will but it adds to how unique it is, and how great it is. I'm not bashing Dark Souls, I really like it and I do intend to finish it soon.
author: AdeyAdey

text: @FunkyKarim93 You've never played 2D Zeldas have you? Plenty of entries in the series have had challenge before. If you mean 3D Zelda + Challenge then yes, it's a shocker, but the enemies and puzzles and such aren't push overs. They aren't mind bogglers, don't think I mean anything really hard, but it's not laughably easy, you have to think for at least a second before you get it, like in an average games difficulty(i.e it's not Mario difficult anymore)

text: This is probably the game I'll be playing after Skyward Sword.
